metadata.Title: CVE-2018-5124 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
Unsanitized output in the browser UI leaves HTML tags in place and can result in arbitrary code execution in Firefox before version 58.0.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-5124` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '58.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
